text: the pendulum is starting to swing this
is a video produced by the organization
keep America safe run by former vice
president Cheney's daughter Liz Cheney
the video has made quite a stir it
criticizes lawyers at the Justice
Department for wanting to have military
tribunals instead of civilian trials for
terrorism detainees earlier I spoke with
legal correspondent John Schwarz about
it the accusation is that these these
lawyers and there are seven to nine of
them but they've but they call them the
al Qaeda seven are somehow conflicted
that they are that these are people who
have worked on detainee cases and
therefore they have a conflict of
interest and the strong suggestion is
they don't have the best interest of the
United States at heart and the reaction
of course has been huge not just from
the people who you would expect that the
sort of liberal left side of the of the
spectrum where anything that a Cheney
says is probably going to get a reaction
but also from the other side but also
right what's what's been emerging since
early this week is is that conservatives
especially many conservatives who are in
the legal profession conservatives who
are legal theorists are also offended
because they say you can't do that to a
lawyer you can't tar a lawyer with the
person he represents because the
question of representation is a
fundamental principle it's a fundamental
constitutional principle why do you
think she did this well I can't get
inside her head but it seems to me that
part of this is the continuing attack on
the Obama administration's Justice
Department and continuing to underscore
the claims that these people are soft on
terrorism the flap over whether Khalid
Sheikh Mohammed would be tried in
civilian courts are under a military
tribunal it's all part of that
continuing thrust but at the same time
it's also an attack on individuals
Oh
